name: Chris Dale
profile: Ambitious and adaptable Web engineer with six years industry experience. Enjoys problem solving, writing clean code and has a strong interest in emerging Web technologies. Currently seeking greater responsibility and new, exciting projects to work on.

company.name: ASOS
company.description: ASOS is an online fashion retailer with over 18 million active customers worldwide. As a solely online shopping experience, ASOS has a strong focus on technical innovation, performance, scalability and quality assurance.

company.name: Creative Services
company.description: Creative Services is a digital consultancy that provides UX, design and engineering expertise to a client-base of predominantly telecommunications companies, government bodies and military services and thus, has a strong focus on security and reliability, as well as technical innovation and legacy support.

experience.description: As a consultant for Creative Services I worked on a variety of projects. This broadened my technical expertise and gave me the experience of working with a range of clients.

projects.title: Vodafone: Ready Business
projects.description: The Ready Business project was a promotional tool that consisted of a set of survey questions, followed by an interactive results page of tailored feedback, scores and product suggestions. The tool was deployed by approx. 20 of Vodafones' international teams and thus, it had to be well documented and easily customisable. As the core developer during the project, I had the following resonsibilities:
responsibilities: Set up and maintain Github repositories and Heroku environments
Build the tool using the pre-chosen set of technologies to match a set of UI designs
Provide progress reports and present demonstrations of the tool to the stakeholders at each stage of the development process, including technical walk-throughs to international teams
QA the tool across different browsers and devices

projects.title: Royal Navy: Web App
projects.description: As part of a two-person development team, I helped build a React App for the client. My responsibilities included:
responsibilities: Build UI components and pages to match visual designs
Build an Express API that mocked the client's ICD
Build a lightweight animated splash screen

projects.title: Three Blog Website
projects.description: I was given the task of finishing a partly-built blog site for Three within a tight deadline. My responsibilities included:
responsibilities: Develop remaining features, including the Load More button, TL;DR switch and an animated GIF pauser
Tidy up the codebase and fix any outstanding defects
Make the UI match the responsive designs pixel-perfectly

company.name: First Utility
company.description: First Utility is an independant gas and electricity supplier in the UK.

experience.description: As a front-end developer at First Utility my responsibilities included... overnight deployments using Jenkins

projects.title: Website rebuild
projects.description: I worked as part of an eight man team to build a fresh, rebranded, responsive version their website and user account system. The website won the 'Utility Website of the Year' award in 2014 and helped quadrouple First Utility's customer base to one million customers.

projects.title: Usage graphs
projects.description: Built an interactive graph using Highcharts with data from an API, including caching.

company.name: mydeco
company.description: MyDeco was a small start-up company that provided an online marketplace for homeware and furniture.

company.name: OpenBet
company.description: OpenBet is a leading sportsbook and gaming software company.

company.name: Verve Media
company.description: Verve Media was a small website design and development agency that I interned for between my second and third year at university.

projects.title: Do A Book Website
projects.description: During my internship at Verve Media I worked on a project for Devon County Council that aimed to encourage creative writing amongst children. The Do A Book website allowed children to download a set of illustrations by a local artist, write their own story to the pictures, and then upload their book for others to read and vote on. My responsibilities included
responsibilities: Write the server-side code for the website
Design and build the relational database
Build a simple Content Management System that allowed administrators to login and maintain website content and uploaded books
